subject: RE: [junit] How do I get results into a file
msgSnippet: just to throw an idea, we actually use directing output to a html file. we also use html to make the report have better look. Shailesh ... From: Jason Rogers
messageBody:
just to throw an idea, we actually use directing output to a html file. we
also use html to make the report have better look.

Shailesh
-----Original Message-----
From: Jason Rogers [mailto:jacaetevha@...]
Sent: Saturday, December 07, 2002 10:04 AM
To: JUnit Yahoo Group
Subject: Re: [junit] How do I get results into a file


The simplest way of saving the results is to direct the output of junit
to a file:
java junit.textui.TestRunner SomeTest > junit.out

The JunitReport you keep hearing about is an Ant task. You can find Ant
at http://jakarta.apache.org/ant -- it's docs are pretty good and there
is a users-group list you can subscribe to.

=jason

On Fri, 06 Dec 2002 17:31:09 -0000, "Mark" <mrbasinger@...> said:
> This message only has an HTML part -- this is a text generated
> representation
>
>
> Hi, I am brand new to Junit and am trying to figure out how to get a
> descriptive report of the results of running test suites through the
> textui.TestRunner. I have seen reference to a JunitReport, but I
> can't find the download for it or javadoc or anything. Basically, I
> just need to be able save results of my tests to a file - XML, HTML,
> TXT, whatever. Any help anyone can give me would be greatly
> appreciated.
> Thanks,
> Mark
